quotes.quote: Arjuna retrieves a Brahmin's stolen wealth from thieves by scattering them with arrows, then returns it to the priest.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A golden bow rests against a tree at dusk, its string still vibrating. A single arrow lies on the grass nearby.
quotes.context: The text describes how Arjuna 'scattered the thieves with arrows and recovered that wealth' (Line 23639) after tracking them down. He then 'brought glory to the Brahmin' (Line 23641) by returning the stolen property. This occurs during Arjuna's travels before his forest exile, showing his commitment to protecting priestly property.

quotes.quote: The Naga princess Ulupi pulls Arjuna underwater into her father's palace, where he performs fire rituals that please the deity Agni.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A single blue-scaled hand emerges from still water, reflecting flickering firelight. The surface shimmers with golden ripples.
quotes.context: Lines 23722-23729 describe how 'the mighty-armed one was pulled down by the daughter of the Naga king' into an underwater palace. There Arjuna sees 'the fire well-arranged' and performs rituals where 'the fire was pleased with his fearless offerings.' This occurs during his pilgrimage at Gangadvara.

quotes.quote: Five celestial nymphs cursed to become crocodiles are freed when Arjuna pulls one from the water, breaking their century-long punishment.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A translucent apsarā floats above river reeds, her pearl necklace dissolving into mist. The last crocodile scale falls like a leaf.
quotes.context: Lines 23926-24051 detail how Arjuna encounters cursed apsarās who explain they were transformed by a sage's anger. When he pulls one crocodile from sacred waters (Line 23930), she reverts to her divine form. The text specifies this occurred at five pilgrimage sites avoided by ascetics due to the cursed nymphs.

quotes.quote: Citravahana, king of Manipura, explains his lineage produces only one heir per generation - either son or daughter - due to an ancient boon from Shiva.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A single lotus blooms in a stone fountain, its reflection perfectly mirrored in still water. No other flowers are visible.
quotes.context: Lines 23862-23872 describe King Citravahana telling Arjuna how his ancestor Prabhankara received Shiva's blessing for 'one offspring in each generation.' His daughter Citrangada thus carries the lineage, as 'she will surely continue our lineage.' This occurs when Arjuna visits coastal Manipura during his travels.
